Welcome to MyNQL’s documentation!¶

MyNQL¶

MyNQL is a Python package that work as a Network Database

Source::
https://github.com/livinter/MyNLQ
Bug reports::
https://github.com/livinter/MyNLQ/issues

The “shape” module¶

class MyNQL.MyNQL(db_name, log_file=None, serializer=None, log_level=40, backward_factor=0.5)[source]¶
connect(nodes1, nodes2, distance=1.0, distance_backward=None, rewrite=False)[source]¶

connect a relation between two nodes, is the relation already exist its closeness will be reduces. if nodes do not exist, they will be created.

>>> x = MyNQL("x").connect("table1.1","table2.3")
>>> x.G[("table1","1")][("table2","3")]
{'distance': 1.0}
>>> _ = x.connect("table1.1","table2.3")
>>> x.G[("table1","1")][("table2","3")]
{'distance': 0.5}
>>> _ = x.connect("table1.1","table2.3", rewrite=True)
>>> x.G[("table1","1")][("table2","3")]
{'distance': 1.0}
Parameters:
  • nodes1 (tuple) – this is a node as a tuple composed like (name/id, category)
  • nodes2 (tuple) – this is a node as a tuple composed like (name/id, category)
  • distance (float) – the closer the distance the more both nodes are related
  • distance_backward (float) –
Returns:
delete(nodes1, nodes2, distance=1.0, distance_backward=None)[source]¶
>>> nql = MyNQL("x").connect("person.juan", "promo.promo1")
>>> nql = nql.delete("person.juan", "promo.promo1")
>>> nx.number_of_nodes(nql.G)
0

delete a connection. if nodes do not have any neighbour anymore, nodes are also deleted. :param node1: :param node2: :param distance: :param distance_backward: :return:

get_categories()[source]¶

all the categories that have been used so far >>> MyNQL(“x”).connect(“person.juan”, “promo.promo1”).get_categories() [‘person’, ‘promo’]

Returns:list of categories

select(nodes_1, category, radius=3.0, in_order=True, limit=None, value_only=True)[source]¶

return [(closeness, node),..] filtered by category ordered by closeness to node1 if no nodes are found and empty list

Parameters:
  • nodes_1 – the starting node for calculating closeness
  • category – the result is reduced to only elements from a specific category
  • radius – reduce search radius to radius
  • in_order – sort output by having the best relation first
  • limit –
  • value_only –
Returns:

best matching nodes
